org.ecs.ecsbeekeeping.flower

Class Flower

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • org.ecs.ecsbeekeeping.flower.Flower
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Daffodil, Fuchsia, Rose

    public abstract class Flower
extends java.util.Observable
    An abstract class which defines a Flower which resides in a Garden

    • Constructor Detail

      • Flower

        public Flower(int pollen)
        Creates a new flower with a certain amount of pollen
        Parameters:
        pollen - The number of units of flower to initialise this flower with.

    • Method Detail

      • grow

        public abstract boolean grow()
        Used to add pollen to the plant. Called every day.
        Returns:
        Whether this flower successfully grew

      • extractPollen

        public int extractPollen(int extract)
        Attempts to extract some pollen from this flower. A bee usually does this.
        Parameters:
        extract - Number of pollen units to extract from this flower
        Returns:
        The number of units successfully extracted. If too much is requested 0 is returned.

      • getPollen

        public int getPollen()
        Gets the number of units of pollen
        Returns:
        Number of units of pollen this flower contains

      • setPollen

        public void setPollen(int pollen)
        Sets the number of units of pollen this flower contains
        Parameters:
        pollen - Number of units to set to

      • getType

        public int getType()
        Gets the type of flower this is. Can be identified by the constants in this class
        Returns:
        This flowers type

      • toSaveString

        public java.lang.String toSaveString()
        Produces a string representation of this flower for saving
        Returns:
        The save string of this flower

        public java.lang.String getName()
